entries.meaning: A false or misleading report or story, especially if deliberately so.
examples: It’s a cinch, now that Spurling has cleared away a century’s worth of misapprehensions and canards.

entries.meaning: (aviation) A type of aircraft in which the primary horizontal control and stabilization surfaces are in front of the main wing.
(aviation, by extension) A horizontal control and stabilization surface located in front of the main wing of an aircraft.
(transport, engineering, by extension) Any small winglike structure on a vehicle, usually used for stabilization.
